summary: Robert L. Keuch is mentioned in several documents related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) investigations into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents primarily consist of correspondence and teletypes between the FBI, HSCA, and other agencies. While the specific role of Robert L. Keuch is not explicitly detailed in the provided summaries, his name appears in the context of background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants. The documents suggest that the HSCA was actively seeking information and files from the FBI related to the assassinations, and Keuch's involvement seems to be connected to the administrative or personnel aspects of the HSCA's operations.
significance: Robert L. Keuch's significance in the JFK context appears to be related to his potential involvement in the administrative or personnel aspects of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents suggest he was subject to background checks as part of the HSCA's operations. However, without more specific information, it is difficult to ascertain the full extent and nature of his role.
